Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, so this isn't matching up with this...and I'm not sure which one's right. Can you just hunt down the original for me?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes. Me do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Kev, what were you saying before about the paperwork?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Me do it now. Go. Stop worry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin, do you feel OK?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Me feel good. Body strong. Sleep big last night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think we should get him to the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, alright Kev why don't you come with us?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, he's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He's always been like that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No he hasn't.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I mean, he's gotten worse over the years....

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He's making a statement. It's an ironic comment on our expectations of him. A funhouse image of our model of Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You keep think that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Me mechanic not speak English. But he know what me mean when me say "car no go", and we best friends. So me think: why waste time, say lot word when few word do trick?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kevin, I appreciate what you're trying to do.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here, we have a word code, the same way we have a dress code. And what we're talking about is...basically the speech equivalent... to just wearing underpants. Sometimes words, you no need use...but need need for talk talk.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But save time. More success.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Does it save time though? 'Cause we've been here for about an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No me fault.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin, at most you're saving a microscopic amount of time.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Many small time make big time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you gonna do with all this time?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: See world.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin, you cannot possibly save enough time to see the world.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: K, Kevin, are you saying "See the world"? or "Sea World?"

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: See world. Oceans. Fish. Jump. China.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, see? Right there, that's the problem with your method. 'Cause I still don't know if you're saying "Sea World" or "see the world," and it's taking a lot of time to explain it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Fine, fine. I'll talk normally.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: When me President, they see. [Nodding and smiling] They see.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This week we are rolling out the brand new Sabre tablet....the Pyramid. [holds up triangle shaped touch pad]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ooh, why is it shaped like that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, you can tell your clients: "Unleash the power of the pyramid."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's huge. How much does it weigh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no no no. Without the battery pack and optional memory booster, it's barely three pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How much memory does it have without the booster?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fifty L.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm sorry," L"?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How many L to a K?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're really going to want the booster.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How on earth are we supposed to sell...?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll take five.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Andy walks in with ties on his arm]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy, don't make us sell this stupid thing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, no no no no no. This is Dwight's meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just wanted to pop in and get your opinions on ties...and tie clips. Which combo do you think Robert is going to like more? [To Oscar] What do you think, C-SPAN?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: ..."C-SPAN"?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. C-SPAN, cocker spaniel. Spaniel because of your Spanish bloodline and cocker cause......

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is this really the best use of our collective time?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am still forming a first impression with Robert. Once it is formed, we can all relax. Ok, I'm sorry to hijack your meeting , D dub dog...had to pull rank.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to group] OK, let's look at some ties.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here's how I'm going to help out from now on. I'm going to not care, and I'm going to sit around quietly waiting for Andy's inevitable demise.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [To Oscar] Your friend Neil Patrick Harris really made me laugh the other night.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Um, D-Dog, you have a message.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Erin, you don't need to call him that.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy wants us to, P-Dog.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's ok E-Dog, just who called?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Justine. She said she's coming by later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Your ex-wife?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, I thought she was a **** and you ******* hated her guts?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Group murmurs, offended]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No no no no. I like her.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well I'm just quoting you. I would never say that about her. I don't know the woman.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nah man, we get along now. Real well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Alright. Can't wait to meet her.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll introduce you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, we had a few fights, I suppose. But last night we put a lot of that to bed. I can't tell you what I did with my ex wife last night.... I have to sing it. [singing] We took a shower, we were naked. We ska dap dap doo doo doo doo doo doo doo.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Robert California] Hi Dad!...... Ahhh....oh boy.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hello, Andy. Excellent tie.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Would you be requiring a cold beverage while you're here?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'd love some coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I was looking over your projections, and I think we can do better.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you factoring in the... whole national ...economy.... declining and all that?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, do you know why I chose you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think I can sum it up with what I think is your favorite ice cream flavor....vanilla?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Vanilla? No no no no. You'll never guess in a million billion years you'll never guess.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You were saying you chose me.... There was a reason?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, can you inspire? Do you have that skill set?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can I inspire? [laughs] I don't know!.....I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Erin enters with overflowing cup of coffee]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh! Thank you. Uh....

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You can just put it down.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Erin sets cup down and Robert sips it]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: That is very cold.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah. It's old. [smiling]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Why would I.....?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I asked if you wanted a cold beverage and you said "coffee"....

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why don't we get Robert a nice hot fresh cup and I will have this.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy, you don't want that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've been craving a freezing cup of old coffee. [sips] Mmm....

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You like her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: She likes you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, we've both been into each other at different times and just never really synced up. Now we're in this weird dance....

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [interrupting] I'm afraid you've lost my interest.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Let me call you back.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I gotta go.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: If the office superstore was supposed to put us little suppliers out of business, why are we still here?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Kevin Raises hand]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ah...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This is where we go

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [chuckling] Oh, you'd go someplace else. That's not it, that's not the answer.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's a answer.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's a wrong answer.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: There are no wrong answers.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Take a look at where you are, where you once worked in a dying industry, you now work at it's birth. Those superstores are terrified of us. Anybody know why?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Wait....they're terrified?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Let me tell you how I buy something these days. I know what I want I go on the internet, I get the best price. Or I don't know what I want and I go to a small store that can help me. The era of personal service is back. You are back. You'll find that customers will pay our higher prices and then they will thank us, and we will say to them "you are welcome." [Applause] Andrew, I chose you for a reason. Lead these people. Show me the best numbers this place has ever seen. Last quarter we saw 4% growth. Double it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Double.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Done.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'm not kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Neither am I, it's already done. Hah, I'm just kidding, it's going to take some time.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Double.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Andy knocks on Jim's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. [Andy pushes things aside and sits on top of Jim's desk, kicking things in the process.]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's up, guys? Just thought we'd have a little rap session, talk about business...see how things are going? Ahem...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why don't you start?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If no one else wants to? I was just thinking about Robert...man. What a boss. Just throws down goals, you know? Anyway, how's the sales doubling ...project going?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, how are we supposed to do that? We can't just press a magic button.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OF course not. There's no magic button. You have to summon that.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If we could just double our sales, we already would have. You're not making any sense.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He brings up two good points. Do you have any new leads? Any new territories you want us to look into? Maybe have an in with a big client that we can get our foot in the door?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight, anything?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We could talk about how fast children grow up, and before you know it they're out of the house.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know what? We need to get our heads out of the box. If we did have something, what would it look like, what would it be? [Jim raises hand] Tuna.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: New leads, a new territory to look into, maybe an in with a big company that we could get our foot in the door...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fart..... good Sesh. [gets up] That leg's asleep.

Quote.Speaker: Justine
Quote.Text: Hello. I'm looking for Darryl Philbin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Don't! oh, you must think...I'm not. I'm using the fax, this isn't, no wait. I'm not supposed to represent the company. Right? There's usually an Erin here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So...DARRYL! A GIRL!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Singing] rub a dub dub...I got scrubbed. 'Sup, darlin'? Everybody, this is Justine. [murmurs of hello from the group] This is Jim and Oscar, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Justine
Quote.Text: Can we.... go some place private?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Follow me, I got a space. After you. I've been thinking about you all mornin'. I don't know what you did, I can barely walk today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: D-Bone. There you are.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me guess, somebody needs a brownie...? Lick the spoon?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, that's ok. Just, I want, I wanted to ask you about...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is this about the profits? Because if it is I just don't see the point. It's so Wall Street.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah...um, how is everything?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good. Really really good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Must be a tough time to be a family farm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it is. And beets are not immune. We made some inroads in salads, but heirloom tomatoes are pushing back.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oof. What are you gonna do about that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know, what do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There's gotta be some way you can double your beet sales...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanted the job, the job is yours. Just do the job! [Licks brownie battered finger] And I'll do mine..... walnuts?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Have you seen this? [Hands Pam Parenting magazine]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Parenting? Yeah. This is Cici's favorite magazine. She loves the pictures of babies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She looks at it when she's on the potty, and she makes the faces.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Have you read it? Has an adult member of your family read this particular issue?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I flipped through it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So you saw the article on the importance of taking frequent walks while you're pregnant?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We know that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I will be taking a morning walk and an afternoon walk. Would you like to join me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That sounds nice.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Great.[Angela walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have a walking buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks for coming in guys.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You don't have to thank us for coming in, it's our job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well I never got thanked for coming into a meeting and I always wanted to be so I'm gonna thank people.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What's with the blanket?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Andy removes blanket over table to reveal various items]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is what's under the blanket.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We don't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: These are incentives. It's how we're gonna double growth. Now, you're probably all asking yourselves: "Well, how does this work?"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Seems like a basic reward system where you give us points, and then we redeem those points for prizes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're exactly right and you get a point.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. [smiling]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, is that a vibrator?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Twenty points.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: How does one get a point?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've outlined the exact parameters in an email, so check your spam folders, but basically you do your job better, you get points. So, collect fifteen points and redeem them for this polar bear.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why is it all kid stuff and a vibrator? It's so gross.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There's lots of stuff. John Irving, collected works, Twenty-two points. Or, you can pool your points and redeem fifty-five for this maternity shirt.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How 'bout you want us to work harder, pay us more.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This point system is really insulting.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ooh I didn't mean to offend you, and I hope you'll forgive me because I am very very... Sari. [tosses yellow print material over shoulder] Sixteen points.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's a tablecloth.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What if we went all the way up to five hundred points?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's a crazy amount of points.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But, what if?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, what do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know, for such a crazy number I'd like something pretty crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright. For five hundred points, I will wear a dress to work. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's pretty good. What about uh, for a thousand points?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll run naked through the parking lot with a donut on my ding-dong. [laughter] Yeah? You like that? Alright! For five thousand points, I will let you tattoo whatever you want on the stern of the old SS Bernard![Andy points to his rear-end]

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Ooooh!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, alright. And you are totally serious?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Swear to God, hope to die. Now let's get to work!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait. You did say we could pool our points, right? In that case...let's get to work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah! Whoo! [Group cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone]I can have it to you by the beginning of next week. Alright? Thanks very much. [hangs up] Uh, Phyllis! Bracken Auto?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [hands Jim folder] Ask for Donald, Karen's bananas.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: T-bag bone...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andrew.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Have you noticed a little bit of a mood shift around here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I didn't notice anything.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really? Because I sat next to Stanley for years....and this is nap time. Open eye nap time. He balances the phone on his shoulder and just powers down. Now look at him.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [On the phone] You've got to unleash the power of the Pyramid!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know what to tell you, man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You think it has something to do with that incentive program?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, one hundred percent. We all want to see you tattoo your ass.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Bah...I think people thought I was kidding when I said that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nah, you definitely weren't kidding. And that came across loud and clear. Oh, by the way, I want to hand this in. [hands Andy slip of paper]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hundred and twenty points.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Big sale. Don't worry about it though, I don't really care about the points. I would like a point receipt though...[on phone] Hey! Yes, this is Jim Halpert calling for Donald...can you hold on for one second? Thank you very much. [gets up to give Erin his point receipt]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who talked to Maggie at Kaufman's?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes! [adds receipt to growing pile and thumbs up Andy.]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone]and I'm back. How are you sir?....I think we can squeeze a couple more golf games in, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Where's Angela? [Hands paper over her shoulder]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Kevin, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Don't talk to me! [Everyone continues to work busily]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hi, Professor Frank, Andy Bernard, class of '95. Hey there, um, I'm a huge fan of your management book, Management. Um, quick question. I may be missing a chapter here...De-Incentivizing. What are your strategies? Looking for a real blow to morale...uh why? Well, um I guess you could say I'm in one of those classic ass tattoo incentive situations. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Erin fills in drawing showing points, crowd cheers and claps]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Took 'em one day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ready! [flips sketch pad showing tattoo possibilities] "I'm not as think as you drunk I am!" [crowd claps and cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I like it, I like it! [Pam flips the page]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do Not Resuscitate...[mild cheering]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK, keep in mind, it's not too late to choose another prize and there are some great new additions. My car [nervous laughter] for a thousand points....or best offer.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What else you got?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, and then this was Phyllis's idea...[shocked cheers] So nasty Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We were hoping you could do something like this...

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: So, coming out of his butt is a...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Baby.

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: Baby...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: Yeah, no problem.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We should think about this...does anyone have any better ideas?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I like what we have.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Looks good.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: For sure. [murmurs from group in agreement]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just need a second outside.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gettin' psyched up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy, nobody really expects you to go through with this...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tunes..what am I doing here? Why did Robert pick me? ....Confession: I don't know what I'm doing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean, do you like it? You having fun? [Andy snorts, unsure how to answer] Tell you this, everybody else is having a lot of fun....and you did that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My ass is only so big, I mean I can't do this everyday.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But I think it's big enough to buy you some time till your next great idea....which, by the way, I can't wait for.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No one expects me to go through with this, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's ink...my stink! [crowd cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My heart belongs to music. But my ass belongs to these people.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Andy removes his pants]

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [lying on table] Do your worst!

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: Uh, you can keep your pants on actually...if just drop 'em down a bit, that'd be great.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They are already off, my good sir.

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: I'd really prefer they not be down.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I think down's better. Sweating pretty heavily down there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you think you could work from this? [showing Tattoo artist sketch pad] we made some small adjustments.

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: OK, you want me to...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just a few adjustments

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: Alright, let's begin.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is where I grin and be-YOW OW!

Quote.Speaker: Tattoo Artist
Quote.Text: That was just the cotton swab.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Invest in softer cotton, sir. [tattooing begins] OW! Oh! Oooh! [Crowd cheers] oh, whoa!!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Obviously you can go the ass tattoo route and obviously, I'm gonna like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: DRAW SOME BLOOD!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: AHHHHH!!!!!!!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Why did I choose Andy to run the office? Because he's all surface, uncomplicated. What you see is what you get. Could be a recipe for mediocrity, yes, but then again, it might just be why people fight for him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [removes tape to reveal tattoo of puppy] It's a Nard Dog! [group cheers] That's my nickity-name! I love it, I love it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pull up your pants.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: There's something about an underdog that really inspires...the unexceptional.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, what should we talk about?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, we could talk about an ethical dilemma I'm having.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, sure. Um, I hope I can help.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: A coworker of mine is drinking caffeine while pregnant, and I don't know if I should call social services about it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela, that's pretty transparently me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know it's just herbal tea.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: In mugs with trace amounts of coffee!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I think you should call social services.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I already did.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, maybe we should just have our own pregnancies and not pretend like we're in this together.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: When you're a kid, you picture a pilot kinda like this [imitates plane noises while steering wildly] But then you learn that's crashing the plane. The right way to do it is more like this. [calmly pulls imaginary steering back and forth] Or better yet, like this. [takes hands off imaginary wheel] Now that I'm manager, I think about that a lot. I let Dwight run the meetings, I let good people do good work and I stay out of the way.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Which combo do you think Robert's gonna like better?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Just wear one of your bowties.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No! I mean, let him, he should just explore other options...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Bowties, no offense, are a black thing. They're for rappers and NBA players. I cringe when I see Tucker Carlson trying to pull off a bowtie. It's like yeah Tucker, you're so street.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is combo number seven.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Hmm, no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't like that clip.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're right, you're right, you're right. Uh! It's so hard to find an occasion for this clip.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'd hang on to it though, cause I can think of a bunch. Like a 70's theme party, or a 70's theme meeting, or a 70's theme convention...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks T-Dog.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: T-Dog?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I thought I was T-Dog.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, he means tuna dog.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna dog!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I thought the plane was flying pretty well on auto-pilot. And then Robert California ran into the cockpit with a gun and he was like "Fly this plane to Cuba, and on the way bomb Texas" Well I don't know how to get there. Or even how to fly, even. And I don't have any bombs.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey. Maybe it'd help to just talk it over. Over a cup of cool old tea.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sighs] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What if you were to just start with your ideas about how to double profits. Just say them all and maybe one of them will rise to the top.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't have any ideas though.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well I have an idea.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You do?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What if Dunder Mifflin were to take on 15-20 foster kids? You'd get huge checks from the government and honestly they would be ecstatic to live in the warehouse. It would be like Hogwart's.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah....I don't think that's legal. It's a nice thought though. [Erin hands Andy a gift] What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I just wanted to say congratulations on your new job, officially.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You didn't have to do that. [opens box to reveal red mouse cat toy attached to key chain]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I saw it at the checkout counter, it made me think of you. I don't know why. I made it into a key chain.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're the only person who's congratulated me.
